title: Epistemology
summary: Epistemology (/ɪˌpɪstəˈmɒlədʒi/ (listen); from Ancient Greek  ἐπιστήμη (epistḗmē) 'knowledge', and  -logy) is the branch of philosophy concerned with knowledge. Epistemologists study the nature, origin, and scope of knowledge, epistemic justification, the rationality of belief, and various related issues. Epistemology is considered a major subfield of philosophy, along with other major subfields such as ethics, logic, and metaphysics.[1]
